text:
PROJECT INNOVATE
March 14, 1967
Mr. Jerrold Sandler, Executive Director
National Educational Radio
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N W.
Washington, D. C. 20036
Dear Jerry:
Enclosed are copies of my letters to Senators Alan Bible, Howard Cannon and
Congressman Walter Baring in which you will note I have taken your name in vein!
I was somewhat shocked but pleased to find that Senator Cannon was on the Commerce
Committee and had lunched with Dr. Killian the day before. He seemed very inÂ¬
terested, but spent a good deal of the time questioning me about the Nevada picture.
He seems very anxious for more information so I therefore leave him in the capable
hands of the NAEB .
Senator Bible's comment was that he has been for ETV since he saw it on a trip to
American Samoa. There's not too much to say after that, is there?
When the bill gets close to going to the House, I think you will find a receptive
audience in the person of Congressman Baring. His office, too, seemed vitally
interested in the Nevada ETV project and what it might do for the state.
The conference was excellent and I was pleased to have the opportunity to attend.
Sincerely,
HELENA. SIDLER (Miss), Coordinator
Research and Development
